intro: Randia albonervia, commonly known as the white-veined randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with prominent white veins, and it produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Randia albonervia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
